sendCommand

public void sendCommand(ITopLevel itl,
                        String s)
                 throws AProverException
Throws:
AProverException

hasToSkip

public int hasToSkip(ITopLevel itl,
                     IDocument doc,
                     String cmd,
                     int beg,
                     int end)
Called before sending an TopLevel.undo() command to the top level when in a file context. Used to determine wether the we shall send TopLevel.undo() to the top level, we shall skip it and stop or TopLevel.undo() for the preceding part of the document.

Parameters:
doc - The current document from which the command was taken
cmd - The command that will be sent
beg - the starting point of the command in the text
end - the ending point of the command in the text
Returns:
One of the values ITopLevel.DONT_SKIP ITopLevel.SKIP or ITopLevel.SKIP_AND_CONTINUE

hasToSend

public int hasToSend(ITopLevel itl,
                     IDocument doc,
                     String cmd,
                     int beg,
                     int end)
Called before sending a command through TopLevel.sendCommand(String) to the top level. Used to determine wether the next command should be sent to the top level, we shall skip it and stop or we shall skip it and try to evaluate the next command.

Parameters:
doc - The current document from which the command was taken
cmd - The command that will be sent
beg - the command in the text before any ITopLevel.SKIP_AND_CONTINUE that could have happened
end - the ending point of the command in the text
Returns:
One of the values ITopLevel.DONT_SKIP ITopLevel.SKIP or ITopLevel.SKIP_AND_CONTINUE

undo

public void undo(ITopLevel itl)
          throws AProverException
Sends to the top level the command to undo one step in the proof.

Parameters:
itl - The toplevel to send the command to
Throws:
AProverException - If anything goes wrong.
